ratings.comment: I was randomly thinking of how great a teacher Dr. W was (years after taking class). I couldnt recall his name other than the first letter and didnt see it on the UW faculty page, so I came here and found it. I googled his name to see if he had moved. Unfortunately Prof W passed away in 2018 at 50. Its really sad, but he was THE BEST prof I had.
Him and the TA are available once a week for 4 hours for homework help. Very good lectures.

Amazing professor. On the easier side but you will have an amazing foundation the subject. Tests were very fair, bell curve. Honors project was fair as well. Office hours are key, he helps so much and wants you to ask questions (but not in class). One of my favorite profs. Awesome!

Westerhoff's lectures are to die for and his exams are to die from.  The class was curved pretty heavily to account for the difficulty of exams, but don't expect to feel good about yourself walking out of exams.  That said, he is very clear in his explanations and will never bore in lecture.  PS go to lecture.

Not just an incredible lecturer and brilliant, Prof. Westerhoff is one of the kindest professors on campus. He really shows an interest in your success. You can tell he puts a lot of effort into his classes. Everything from the problem sets to exams were great, and you will learn a lot in his class.
This man is brilliant and easily the best physics professor you will ever have.
Professor Westerhoff is awesome! I had him for 322 as well. Very good lectures and very helpful in office hours.
Second semester with him.  It's too bad we can't bring him along as our prof. every semester, otherwise we would.  He is very good.

Prof Westerhoff is by far the best professor I have ever had. He is the most organized and clear teacher. Even if the subject matter is hard, he explains it in a manner which is easily understood. I'm sad I can't have every physics class taught to me by this man.

Best physics professor i've had at Madison. He made mechanics lectures as interesting as he could, and everything was always clear. The class was difficult, but it was the material and not the professor. Really nice guy in office hours too. Take him for anything that you can.

Very challenging but interesting course. Westerhoff is easily one of the best professor's in the department. Lectures are extremely clear and vital to understanding the material. HW's and exams are very difficult, but the curve is pretty good.
His lectures are very organized and are entirely composed of derivations. Homework is doable... if you go to discussion, where the TA tells you how to do all the problems. Exams are pretty hard.
Prof. Westerhoff is the man! This guy is an excellent teacher, far and away the best prof. in the physics dept (him and C.C. Lin of course). And he's also like 25' tall
